org.androidtransfuse.event
Class EventManager

java.lang.Object
  org.androidtransfuse.event.EventManager

@Singleton
public class EventManager
extends Object

Centralized Bus for registering, unregistering and triggering events. An event may be any object and the EventManager triggers observers based on the non-generic type of the event object. Observers may be registered by calling the register() method, which relates an observer to an event type.

Transfuse will generate the calls to register() and unregister() based on the @Observes annotation. Any method in an object managed by Transfuse annotated with @Observes will register a call to that method with the first parameter in the method as the Event type.

For instance: 

     @Observes
     public void drink(Coffee coffee){...}
will result in Transfuse generating a the following EventObserver: 
     public class DrinkCoffeeEventObserver{
         ...
         void trigger(Coffee coffee){
             managedInstance.drink(coffee);
         }
     }
and the following registration: 
     eventManager.register(Coffee.class, drinkCoffeeEventObserver);

Author:
John Ericksen

register

public <T> void register(Class<T> event,

Register the given observer to be triggered if the given event type is triggered.

Type Parameters:
T - relating type
Parameters:
event - type

trigger

public void trigger(Object event)
Triggers an event through the EventManager. This will call the registered EventObservers with the provided event.

Parameters:
event - object

unregister

public void unregister(EventObserver<?> observer)
Unregisters an EventObserver by equality.

Parameters:
observer - Event Observer
